text:
New York City's New Hospital for the Treatment of Tuberculosis.
Nov. 14, 1913
F.A. Walter, photographer
title: Staten Island - Seaview Hospital - [Hospital for The Treatment of Tuberculosis]

text:
(1)
Welfare Island, its western shore on the East River, as seen from Carl Schurz Park, looking southward. In the right background is visible the Queensborough Bridge.
Summer 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date.
June 24, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The eastern shore of the island, as seen from the State Barge Canal Terminal, Long Island City, looking southward.
November 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Welfare Island.

text:
Welfare Island (center of view), looking westward from the Queens end of the Queensborough Bridge. In the foreground appears part of the shore of Long Island City, Queens, and across the island; Manhattan.

July 17, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Welfare Island.

text:
View of northern tip of Welfare Island, looking north east from No. 25 East End Ave., Manhattan, into Astoria L.I. Hell Gate Bridge may also be seen in the background.

About 1930.

Wurts Brothers.
title: Islands - Welfare Island.

text:
(1)
Welfare Island, the eastern shore of its southern half, in the East River.  Also shown, across the island is the skyline of Midtown Manhattan.  The point of vantage is the foot of Harris Ave., Long Island City.

November 6, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date. The same vantage point as in view 1.

June 24, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)

The same, at a still later date, as seen from the Queensborough Bridge.

March 5, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Midtown Manhattan skyline.]

text:
Welfare Island: The north end of the island, showing some of the hospital buildings. View 1 is from about East 65th street, Manhattan, and shows the island chapels.

View 3 shows the pier and a new hospital under construction, Shown, too, is the Queensboro Bridge.

View 1: George L. Balgue                          August, 1930


Views 2,3: P. L. Sperr

View 2: August 3, 1938
View 3: July 1, 1937
title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital.

title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital.

text:
Lower end of Welfare Island; formerly Blackwell's Island: showing the City prison and workhouse, and also the City Hospital.

About 1933.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Metropolitan Hospital - City prison.]

text:
(1) City Hospital. Welfare Island, as seen from East 53rd Street, Manhattan.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same view, from 52nd Street.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A more general view, from another angle, of the lower half of Welfare Island also, showing the City Hospital on the southern end.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
(1)
Penitentiary and City Hospital, on the south end of Welfare Island; as seen from the Queensboro Bridge; looking south west into Manhattan.
March 5, 1933.
P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same view from a slightly different angle.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr

(3)
Penitentiary and the City Hospital, on the southern half of Welfare Island, looking south east to Brooklyn.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr

text:
Welfare Island: A northeastward view of the southern tip of the Island with the Queensborough Bridge and the Long Island City shore (right) for a background.

Fall 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Long Island City shore.]

text:

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same view, in close-up. June 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
